arguments.description: StaticPages builds static HTML files using XML + XSL.
arguments.title: StaticPages

argument.name: --project-dir
argument.description: The base path of your project.

argument.name: --new-project
argument.description: Creates a default project in the specified directory.

argument.name: --asset-prefix-in-browser
argument.description:
Provides a way to prefix assets as seen in the browser. This is always relative to your domain. The resulting prefix is never allowed to end in '/'. This means that '/' would be converted to '' and '/url/' would be converted to '/url'.
The default value is '' which will result in all assets being prefixed with '/'. :)

argument.name: --log4j-properties
argument.description:
Sets the location of the log4j.properties. By default, StaticPages looks in the current dir of the jar for the properties file.
This may be an absolute or relative path. Relative paths are resolved against the StaticPages.jar file.

argument.name: --log4j-interval
argument.description: Sets the amount of time to watch for log4j.properties changes.

argument.name: --clean
argument.description: Cleans all resources in the given projce build directory when true.

argument.name: --enable-asset-fingerprinting
argument.description: Enables or disables asset fingerprinting. An asset fingerprint contains a unix timestamp of the following format just before the file extension: 'file.UTC23452345345.js'. The benefit of using a fingerprint in this manner, is that you can easily write a recursive directory scanner that can clean up old assets from time to time.

argument.name: --enable-dev-mode
argument.description: Enables dev mode. Certain features are only available when dev mode is enabled.

argument.name: --max-data-uri-size-in-bytes
argument.description: Sets the maximum size (in bytes) of data uri embedded resources within css. The default is the limit imposed by IE8 (32768).

argument.name: --max-wait-time-to-validate-external-link
argument.description: Sets the number of milliseconds to wait for an external link reference to return.

argument.name: --prefix-to-ignore-files
argument.desctiption: Files with this prefix will be ignored.
